result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn Ronald Schmitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs to be paid in installments of $100.00 per month commencing 02-01-2017 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Ordered bond posted of $150.00 be applied.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Ronald Schmitt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shawn Ronald Schmitt in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant will plead to D.C. and State remove the domestic abuse allegation; fine $100 + costs.  Court amends  to eliminate the domestic abuse allegation; advises defendant of charge w/o domestic abuse allegation;   PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty; assess fine $100 + costs for total of $579; apply bond of $150; TTP $100/mo. com. 2/1/17; complete TTP; advised of appeal rights.
Status conference on December 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Allan L Morgan in court. Defendant f/t/a. Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Morgan surprised his client is not here for court, requests time to get a hold of him before warrant issued.  Court authorizes warrant and gives Mr. Morgan time to contact his client.  Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shawn Ronald Schmitt in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Morgan informs he was just retained this afternoon, waive reading of complaint and enter NGP, request STC.  Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shawn Ronald Schmitt in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charge/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant wishes to contact an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on September 19, 2016 at 08:45 am.
